Text: Public confidence in the Supreme Court polled at just 25% last week. And that was before the Court overturned Roe v. Wade. Donald Trump and Mitch McConnell damaged and delegitimized SCOTUS when they stole two seats. Expanding the Court by four more seats will restore it. https://t.co/eZttwZbr0t

The fight for the right to abortion continues in a post-Roe world. We have to do everything we can in Congress, in local government, and at the ballot box to fight back against this Supreme Court decision. Go to https://t.co/WrSdsRypcz and organize to protect abortion.
Add four more seats to the Supreme Court, take back the stolen majority, and restore legitimacy to the Court.

We are in a post-Roe world and there is now one question before us. Will we allow the far-right to have the last word on abortion? NO! We must fight back against this stolen Court, abolish the filibuster, codify Roe v. Wade, and expand the Supreme Court of the United States.

To the activists and organizers who power Sonia's movement, thank you for being in this fight, for leading with your progressive values, and for your commitment to one another and the vision of a just and livable future.

.@SoniaChangDiaz ran a courageous and unabashedly progressive campaign prioritizing climate justice and centering the needs of working people and the systematically disenfranchised. She has built a powerful movement for change and I am deeply grateful for her leadership. https://t.co/o3FadMM5QZ
Today's decision will have devastating and dangerous impacts across our nation, but let me be clear—the right to a safe and legal abortion is still protected in Massachusetts.

The Supreme Court has overruled Roe v. Wade, executing a decades-long, far-right plot to destroy the constitutional right to abortion and forever eroding any semblance of legitimacy this stolen Court once held. There can be no question now that we must expand the Supreme Court.

Celebrating Juneteenth today in Brockton with @rahsaandhall who is running for District Attorney of Plymouth County to restore accountability and public trust to the office. I’m supporting Rahsaan and I hope that you will too. https://t.co/wzVD2rqQMk

My father worked hard every day of his life to support our family. He taught me so much and cared for my mother with great compassion and strength as she developed Alzheimer’s. I’m forever grateful for my dad and want to wish him and fathers everywhere a happy Father’s Day. https://t.co/P6akfsUd7F
We must continue, on this Juneteenth and every day, to recommit ourselves and our agenda to the fight for justice in all its forms, and to the movement for Black liberation.

I’m proud that last year, my legislation recognizing Juneteenth as a federal holiday was signed into law—but the truth is that marking a day on the calendar and calling it a job well done is simply not enough.
There is racial injustice in our courts, our schools, our hospitals, our workplaces, the air we breathe, the water we drink, our blocks, neighborhoods, towns, and cities.

We must understand that Black people in the United States of America have never been fully freed, and that white supremacy and systemic racial injustice continue to plague our society from top to bottom.

It is a reminder that the struggle for racial justice in this country has too-often been delayed and unfulfilled, and that the true story of this nation has been hidden and diminished as we fail to reckon with our past head-on.

Juneteenth is a reminder of America’s original sin of slavery—a day to reflect on our nation’s shared, painful history, as well as the work we still have to do in order to make equality and justice a reality for all.

My bill, the MASS Act, would incentive every state to pass the same firearm licensing rules we have in Massachusetts—a critical tool to help keep guns out of the hands of those who should not have them and prevent firearm deaths.

David is absolutely right. Massachusetts has proven the NRA's bogus talking points wrong again and again Our strong gun laws—including strict licensing standards, a red flag law, and an assault weapons ban—help save lives. The rest of the country needs to follow suit. https://t.co/CPQHpYfFSh

Right now the question before every Republican is this: do you have the courage to stand up to the NRA, to stand with the American people, and to finally take meaningful action on gun safety? https://t.co/FDoN2KSeeM

Congress has a moral responsibility to protect children in our schools and people everywhere from gun violence. If Republicans refuse to meet that moral responsibility, then they are complicit in the violence and suffering that we have seen unfold again and again.

As we mark the second anniversary of the murder of George Floyd, let us reckon with our country's history of white supremacy and police violence and let us honor George Floyd's memory with action, abolish qualified immunity, and hold police accountable.
We need to abolish the filibuster, get these Republicans out of the way, and then move urgently to pass gun safety legislation that will save lives.

The Republican Party is a wholly-owned subsidiary of the NRA. They have allowed us to become the only nation in the world where massacres in our schools, grocery stores, places of worship, and elsewhere happen regularly. And after yet another tragedy, they offer nothing.

We must abolish the filibuster, codify Roe v. Wade, and move urgently to expand the Court so that we forever protect the constitutional right to abortion. 

https://t.co/XvlDBHjZq8
Republicans made up their mind a long time ago: they would do whatever it takes to destroy Roe v. Wade. We must expand the Court to protect it. (7/7)

But if we do not expand the Court, we will face the continued dismantling of constitutional rights enjoyed by all Americans and the concentration of power in the hands of the far-right at the expense of people of color, women, LGBTQ+ people, and our immigrant communities. (6/7)

When we expand the Supreme Court, President Biden will be able to confirm four new Justices so that it actually reflects the will of the American people. He will undo the damage that Republicans have done. And he will protect Roe v. Wade. (5/7)

That is how the Supreme Court majority was stolen and now, as the right to abortion and the fundamental right to privacy are about to be stripped away, Congress must act, pass the Judiciary Act of 2021, and expand the Court by four more seats. (4/7)

Then, in 2020, despite having just insisted, "no Supreme Court appointments in a presidential election year," Republicans moved quickly to confirm Justice Amy Coney Barrett as ballots were being cast that would kick Trump out of the White House and elect President Biden. (3/7)

Six years ago, then-Senate Majority Leader McConnell blocked President Obama from fulfilling his duty to seat a Supreme Court Justice. Republicans held that seat open for a year until Donald Trump could appoint a right-wing Justice to the Court. (2/7)

Republicans want you to believe that the Supreme Court majority was not stolen. They want you to look the other way as an illegitimate Court overrules the settled law of Roe v. Wade. But the truth is that McConnell and Trump stole two seats. 

Here's how they did it. (1/7)

The urgency of this assault on abortion rights demands that each of us do what we can to support people seeking abortions. Please split a contribution now to the @BrigidAlliance, @IWRising, @ARC_Southeast, @JaneFundMA, @WRRAP, and @reproequity_now. https://t.co/a8l71bkSKk

The Senate should immediately abolish the filibuster and pass the Women’s Health Protection Act, codifying Roe v. Wade as law and protecting the right to an abortion from the stolen Supreme Court majority.

If anyone had any reservations about expanding the Supreme Court, it is now time to face reality and do what is right. We can put an end to McConnell and Trump's stolen far-right majority, protect abortion rights, and stop this attack on Americans' freedom and safety.
